alert.note: Alert for Eddy (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 02 at 2:31PM MDT until October 02 at 5:15PM MDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR CENTRAL EDDY COUNTY... At 231 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain. Spotters have reported flash flooding across U.S. Highway 285. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 1 hour. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Brantley Lake State Park, Lakewood and Lake Avalon. This includes the following streams and drainages... Fourmile Draw, North Seven Rivers, Pecos River, Rocky Arroyo, South Seven Rivers and Sheep Draw. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
